item.title: Online loans: 'I went from loaning £150 to owing £6,000 in months'
item.description: Within months of his first payday loan, Tom owed thousands of pounds to 10 lenders.

item.title: Bank holiday: Travel warning as sunshine forecast in Wales
item.description: Drivers warned travel times could double as people head to enjoy the bank holiday weekend weather.

item.title: Flintshire: Milk vending machine business may be shut down
item.description: People were fined for travelling 20 miles to get milk from the roadside machines during lockdown.

item.title: Covid outbreak in two north Wales hospitals
item.description: The hospitals have 34 patients with Covid with 14 being linked to the outbreak.

item.title: Shotton: Woman whose death prompted murder arrest named locally
item.description: Jade Ward was found dead at a property in Shotton, Flintshire, at about 09:30 BST on Thursday.

item.title: Covid: New Wales school guidance flabby, says trade union
item.description: New rules mean schools will have "variable measures" around tests, face masks and social distancing.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Unvaccinated travel ban call as cases rise
item.description: A GP makes the call as it is announced there will be no significant changes to Covid rules in Wales.

item.title: Clydach murderer: David Morris died after collapsing in prison
item.description: David Morris was serving a 32-year sentence for killing three generations of the same family.

item.title: Cardiff court appearance for man charged with 1980 rape
item.description: Roland Long, 67, was told to appear at Cardiff Crown Court after being granted unconditional bail.

item.title: Wrexham murder investigation victim named as Karl Saffy
item.description: Karl Saffy, 57, from Penycae, will be missed by many, say his family.

item.title: Staycation: Tourism rethink needed after north Wales boom
item.description: As queues continue up Snowdon, those living in beauty spots say better infrastructure is needed.

item.title: Bala Lake tourists warned as blue-green algae found in water
item.description: Bala Lake is the third Welsh lake since May to have blue-green algae found in it.

item.title: Payday lenders: 'They are robbing the vulnerable'
item.description: Within months of his first £150 payday loan, Tom owed £6,000 to 10 lenders.

item.title: Snowdon: Amputee crawls up mountain to raise funds for children
item.description: It will be the first time Paul Ellis has made his way up a mountain after losing his legs in 2008.

item.title: North Wales tourism has strained communities, authority says
item.description: Snowdonia National Park Authority said numbers visiting brought benefits and challenges.

item.title: Scrapping theory tests could cut HGV driver shortage, says instructor
item.description: One lorry driving instructor said it can take up to 16 months to train up new drivers.

item.title: Covid: Stay outside for the bank holiday, minister urges
item.description: Health Minister Eluned Morgan said, amid rising case rates, people need to take precautions

item.title: Wales donates unneeded PPE to help Covid-hit Namibia
item.description: Masks, gowns and sanitiser are being sent to help the country as it struggles with a third wave.

item.title: United Rugby Championship: Live televised games return to BBC Cymru Wales
item.description: Friday night rugby will return to BBC Cymru Wales after a free-to-air television deal is announced with the new United Rugby Championship competition.

item.title: United Rugby Championship: New league unveils inaugural fixture list
item.description: The new United Rugby Championship reveals its inaugural fixture list for the 2021-22 season and will begin on 24 September.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Kadeena Cox sets new world record to win gold
item.description: British star Kadeena Cox sets a new world record to retain her C4-5 500m time trial title at the Tokyo Paralympics.

item.title: Steve Evans: Age just a number for ex-Wales defender, 42, after playing comeback
item.description: Former Wales international Steve Evans hopes a playing comeback at the age of 42 will lead to a managerial role.

item.title: Ben Tozer: Wrexham sign Cheltenham Town captain Tozer
item.description: Ambitious National League side Wrexham sign Cheltenham Town captain Ben Tozer for an undisclosed fee.

item.title: Clwstwr achosion Covid-19 mewn dau ysbyty yng Ngwynedd
item.description: Mae hanner y cleifion sydd â Covid yn Ysbyty Gwynedd ac Ysbyty Eryri yn gysylltiedig â'r clwstwr newydd.

item.title: Gallai mwy o gleifion ysbyty weld cyfyngiadau eto
item.description: Bydd yr adolygiad nesaf yn ystyried a oes angen prawf o fod wedi cael brechlyn i gael mynediad i leoliadau risg uchel.

item.title: Agor cwest i farwolaeth llofrudd Clydach
item.description: Bu farw David Morris yn y carchar ar 20 Awst, ond nid yw achos ei farwolaeth wedi ei gadarnhau.

item.title: Pum munud gyda'r artist Camilla Jane Gittins
item.description: Hanes y artist o Meifod sy'n arbenigo mewn tirluniau a'i llwyddiant yn y cyfnod clo.

item.title: Cymru Premier: Y Drenewydd yn curo Caernarfon
item.description: Caernarfon yn colli yn erbyn Y Drenewydd yng ngornest gyntaf penwythnos Gŵyl y Banc.
